sense.name: unbalance, perturb, throw out of kilter
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1 DERANGE NP2 NP1[agent] DERANGE NP2
sense.examples: The death of his parents deranged him. The quality of her clothes threatened to derange Frieda and me. Fundamental Islamicists threaten to derange the social order in Algeria and Egypt.
